Cone of Vision (C.O.V.): The approximately 60-degree cone from the viewer's eye that represents the distortion-free viewing area. Objects outside this cone appear warped.
Minor Axis: The shortest diameter of an ellipse. In perspective drawing, the minor axis is always aligned with the perspective axis (center line) of a cylinder or circular form.
Major Axis: The longest diameter of an ellipse, perpendicular to the minor axis.
Core Shadow: The part of an object that faces away from the light source. Also called form shadow.
Terminator: The edge between the light side and shadow side of an object. Often appears as the darkest area due to the rapid transition from light to shadow.
